result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Blandin

defendant.name: Blandin, Jerome
defendant.address: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jerome Blandin
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: 1906 Windom Way, Madison, WI 53704

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:16 AM Defendant Jerome Blandin in court. ADA Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant has signed a Waiver of Right to an Attorney. Court colloquy with defendant regarding right to an attorney. 

Law Enforcement, Officer H. Johnson, duly sworn & testified; Direct exam by ADA Jay. Venue Established. Witness ID'd defn; Cross exam by defendant. State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; No objection to bindover; Ct binds case over; bail continued

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:36 PM Defendant Jerome Blandin in court. ADA Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court colloquy with Defn regarding Attorney and time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant does not want to have an attorney. Court provides defendant a Waiver of Right to An Attorney and case will be called at scheduled time today.

- Defendant shall not be at any OReilly Auto Parts location. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Altisha R. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:49 PM Defendant Jerome Blandin in court, in custody.  Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court for Jerome Blandin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant declined assistance of Public Defender and indicated that they are a Moorish National. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
